title: Strictly's Mike is 'chuffed' over dance-off performance against Catherine Tyldesley
text:

Mike Bushell has said that he was "chuffed" with his performance in the Strictly dance-off at the weekend.

The BBC presenter faced former Coronation Street actress Catherine Tyldesley after they both landed in the bottom two, but was controversially saved by the judges.

Appearing on It Takes Two today with pro partner Katya Jones, Mike said that he had been incredibly happy about how he had performed.

He told host Rylan Clark-Neal: "I was actually really chuffed with how it went. Not only the main dance but the dance-off, it was our best run.

"The clock-ography was on time!"

(Image: GC Images)

"It was challenging because there was a lot of footwork, a lot of new steps down in the frame and it was very different to anything I'd ever done before," Mike said.

Yesterday, a tearful Catherine appeared on the spin-off show and struggled to rewatch her doomed dance and compared her exit to a "divorce".

Catherine and partner Johannes Radebe's exit sparked fury for some, who were angry that head judge Shirley Ballas chose to save the latter couple.

Appearing on It Takes Two today, Catherine admitted that she was "gutted" to be out of the dancing competition.

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

"I'm gutted. I kind of thought, hoped that we had a couple of weeks left," Catherine told host Rylan Clark-Neal. "I struggled with the Cha Cha, it was evil!"

As they began to air a clip of their dance, Catherine gasped and exclaimed: "Let's not... no!"

Meanwhile Johannes admitted that he had been worried that they would be in the dance-off after landing at the bottom of the leaderboard.

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

"I was very worried. i became a student and she became a teacher," he explained. "She said 'Listen, we're going to go out there and have fun!'"

Catherine added about her exit: "I feel like I've gone through a divorce and I've got Jojo!

"Friendship for life, it's absolutely phenomenal."

Earlier today, Mike confessed that he'd received online abuse and trolling because he was saved over Catherine.

However judge Craig hit out at the nasty online comments and defended saving the sports presenter.

(Image: BBC)

He also suggested it was the right decision to send Catherine home over Mike, not regretting his dance-off vote.

He told hosts Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield on This Morning today: "They are [all so good] and the ones who weren’t so good have sort have gone really, and now it's quite even stevens.

"It really is up to the audience to start voting and deciding who they don’t want in that bottom two."

On backlash over Catherine's exit: "This is the problem with Catherine leaving and what seems to be a great controversy... and it’s not.

"I don’t see it that way at all, in my opinion Mike was better, just on the night.

"If she had been dancing, I’ve got to be honest, the rumba against him, then she would have nailed it and gone straight through.”

*Strictly: It Takes Two airs weekdays at 6.30pm on BBC Two
description: The BBC presenter landed in the bottom two with the former Coronation Street actress, but was saved by judges Craig and Shirley
